column4: Facebook suspends Canadian firm AggregateIQ over data scandal
column5: Facebook Inc  said on Friday that it had suspended Canadian political consultancy AggregateIQ from its platform after reports that the data firm may have improperly had access to the personal data of Facebook users.

column4: Brazil's BRF board taps Furlan to replace Diniz as chairman
column5: SAO PAULO The board of directors of Brazil's BRF SA  the world's leading poultry exporter  on Friday taped former trade minister Luiz Fernando Furlan to replace retail mogul Abilio Diniz as chairman  according to a securities filing.

column4: Brazil's BRF board taps Furlan to replace Diniz as chairman

column4: Deutsche Bank board to discuss CEO and make decision on Sunday
column5: FRANKFURT Deutsche Bank's  supervisory board intends to "take a decision" on Sunday after discussing John Cryan's job at the helm of the bank  the German lender said late on Saturday.

column4: UPDATE 3-Deutsche Bank board to discuss CEO and make decision on Sunday
column5: * Brief statement confirms earlier reports of meeting and topic

column4: Deutsche Bank chairman to hold call with board over CEO -Handelsblatt
column5: FRANKFURT  April 7 The possible replacement of Deutsche Bank Chief Executive John Cryan could be discussed on a call with board members scheduled on Sunday evening by Supervisory Board Chairman Paul Achleitner  German newspaper Handelsblatt reported.

column4: Fluor tenders work to Grana y Montero for Quellaveco Peru mine
column5: LIMA  April 7 U.S.-based construction firm Fluor Corp subcontracted earth moving work on the Quellaveco copper mine in Peru to local company Grana y Montero  in a sign the stalled $5 billion project could be reactivated.

column4: China trade dispute could slam U.S. retailers
column5: NEW YORK  April 6 The Trump administration's trade dispute with Beijing could slam U.S. retailers if tariffs are implemented and lead to higher prices or a shortage of merchandise.

column4: ISS recommends against Goldman pay plan  worried on costs
column5: BOSTON Proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services on Friday recommended investors vote against a stock plan for employees at Goldman Sachs Group Inc  concerned about its costs and the bank's heavy use of stock-based compensation.

column4: ISS recommends against Goldman pay plan  worried on costs
column5: BOSTON  April 6 Proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services on Friday recommended investors vote against a stock plan for employees at Goldman Sachs Group Inc  concerned about its costs and the bank's heavy use of stock-based compensation.

column4: LATAM Airlines union says to strike starting Tuesday
column5: SANTIAGO The Cabin Crew Union of LAN Express  a subsidiary of the Chile-based LATAM Airlines group  said workers would strike on Tuesday after mediation with the government failed to produce a new labor contract.

column4: UPDATE 1-LATAM Airlines union says to strike starting Tuesday
column5: SANTIAGO  April 7 The Cabin Crew Union of LAN Express  a subsidiary of the Chile-based LATAM Airlines group  said workers would strike on Tuesday after mediation with the government failed to produce a new labor contract.

column4: China's Tianqi alleged errors in Chile effort to block SQM stake - papers
column5: SANTIAGO China's Tianqi Lithium Corp  said there were errors in a Chilean government agency's effort to block its purchase of a stake in local mining company SQM   local newspapers La Tercera and El Mercurio reported on Saturday.

column4: Proxy adviser ISS recommends vote for all Wells Fargo board nominees
column5: Proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) on Friday recommended Wells Fargo & Co shareholders vote for all Wells Fargo board nominees at the bank's annual meeting on April 24.
